lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: What a WONDERFUL morning! I slept like an absolute angel.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The morning light filters through dusty curtains.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Something feels... wrong. Or right, depending on your perspective.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl? Is that... why does the couch smell like copper?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I should show Paul around. He's going to LOVE what I've done with the place.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The house is quiet. Too quiet. Something isn't right.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The bedroom door creaks open.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The sheets are torn off the bed.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: And there are drag marks on the floor.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Oh that? I was rearranging. Feng shui, Paul!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Something glints under the overturned nightstand.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The bathroom mirror is fogged over.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Someone has written on it with a finger.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: 'SORRY'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: That's Carl's handwriting.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Oh that was just a note to myself! Sorry I used all the hot water!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: What... what is this?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Is that... blood?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The kitchen counter is smeared with dark crimson.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A trail leads from the sink to the basement door.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: My cranberry sauce experiment! The viscosity is PERFECT.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: That is NOT cranberry sauce, Carl.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: A key? It says 'BASEMENT' on the tag.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Why is it covered in... I don't want to know.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Oh you found my studio key! Let me give you the tour!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A rusty iron key. The tag reads 'BASEMENT' in faded letters.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: It's covered in something dark and sticky.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: The basement. I have to check the basement.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You're going to LOVE it down there, Paul!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The lock clicks. The door swings open to darkness.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The stairs creak with each step.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The air grows cold and damp.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: What's that smell?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Art, Paul. That's the smell of ART.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A single bare bulb flickers overhead.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh god oh god oh god.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: CARL!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: CARL WHAT DID YOU DO?!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: In the corner, something that was once human.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Ta-da! What do you think of my gallery? The symmetry is important.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I... I have to get out of here.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I have to get out of here.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I have to tell someone.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul? Paul, where are you going? You haven't seen the best part!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I made it JUST for you!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The morning air hits Paul like a wall of cold water.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Behind him, Carl waves from the kitchen window, beaming.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The note reads:

lines.speaker: note
lines.text: 'DON'T GO TO THE BASEMENT. -C'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl... what is down there?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A crumpled piece of paper, stained with what looks like blood.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The handwriting is cheerful, with a smiley face drawn at the bottom.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Carl wrote this recently. The ink is still slightly wet.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A leather-bound journal. The pages are warped from moisture.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl's handwriting... this goes back months.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The entries start cheerful, then grow increasingly... creative.

lines.speaker: note
lines.text: 'Tuesday: Made something special today. Paul doesn't appreciate my art yet.'

lines.speaker: note
lines.text: 'Friday: The basement is filling up. Need more barrels. What a productive week!'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Oh Carl. Oh no.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Carl's journal. Dozens of entries, each more cheerfully horrifying than the last.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The final entry is just the word 'MASTERPIECE' written over and over, surrounded by drawings.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A phone with a shattered screen. One unsent message glows dimly.

lines.speaker: note
lines.text: 'HELP IM AT 42 ELM STREET THE LL'

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Someone tried to call for help.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: They didn't finish typing.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The phone is cracked and barely functional.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The battery is dead. No way to send the unfinished message.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Whoever this belonged to... they were here. Recently.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A photograph in a cracked frame.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Two llamas stand side by side - one grinning manically, the other looking exasperated.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Great times! Remember that day, Paul? The picnic?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: You mean the day you brought 'homemade sausages' and nobody could identify the meat?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Wait! You didn't try my sauce!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: It's my best batch yet! The secret ingredient is commitment!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I need to get away from that kitchen.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Paul? PAUL! Come back!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You didn't even see the centerpiece! I worked SO hard on it!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Carl's voice echoes up the stairwell, growing more desperate.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I'm never going back down there.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl... what happened last night?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: I can't remember anything. But the house smells terrible.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Morning, Paul! Wonderful morning, isn't it?

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl, something smells like death in here.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Probably my cranberry sauce! It's still reducing in the kitchen.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Or maybe it's my basement project. Art can be pungent, Paul.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Art doesn't smell like this, Carl.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl, why is there red on... everything?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Oh that? Art supplies! Finger painting!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You should try it sometime, Paul. Very therapeutic.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl, that is not paint.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: It's paint-ADJACENT. The important thing is the artistic process!

options.text: I need to check the kitchen.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl, the bedroom is destroyed. There are drag marks.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I was rearranging! Feng shui, Paul!

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: There are claw marks on the floor, Carl.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Heavy furniture! You know how it is.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Besides, I got all the stains out. Eventually.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Someone wrote 'SORRY' on the bathroom mirror.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Oh that! I was apologizing for using all the hot water.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: In blood, Carl?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Look, Paul, buddy, pal...

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Sometimes art happens on unexpected canvases!

options.text: I need to search this place.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: What's in the basement, Carl?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: My GALLERY! Oh Paul, you're going to love it!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I've been working on something really special.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: That's exactly what someone says when there's something horrible down there.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Horrible? It's BEAUTIFUL, Paul. I put weeks into this.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The key? Oh, I hid it for safekeeping!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Can't have just ANYONE seeing the gallery before it's ready.

lines.speaker: paul
lines.text: Carl...

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Fine! Check the bedroom. Under the nightstand.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: But prepare yourself, Paul. It's going to blow your mind.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Sure thing, buddy!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Let me know if you want a guided tour!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I'll be in the kitchen. Working on my reduction.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: PAUL! Wonderful morning! Did you see what I did with the kitchen?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I've been SO productive. You wouldn't believe.

options.text: What did you do in the kitchen?

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Cranberry sauce! Well, SAUCE. The cranberry part is... optional.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I tried a new gravity-assisted technique. Very avant-garde.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The ceiling got a little messy, but art is messy, Paul!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Not sauce? Of COURSE it's sauce!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Well, it's sauce-adjacent. The viscosity is right.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: You always focus on the negative, Paul. Appreciate the texture!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Isn't it wonderful? That's the smell of CREATIVITY.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I've been working on my basement gallery. It's almost ready!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The centerpiece is going to be LEGENDARY, Paul.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: My MASTERPIECE! Oh Paul, I can't wait to show you!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: I've been curating for weeks. The symmetry is PERFECT.

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Every piece tells a story. A short story, but still!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: Okay! I'll be here if you change your mind!

lines.speaker: carl
lines.text: The gallery isn't going anywhere. Neither are the exhibits!

carl: Ah, the couch! Perfect for post-project napping.
I did some of my best planning right here.
paul: Our couch. Carl's been sleeping on it lately.
There's a suspicious stain I don't want to examine.

carl: Great table! Perfect for laying out blueprints.
And other activities.
paul: The dining table. We used to eat here together.
Now I'm not sure what happens at this table anymore.

carl: Perfect workspace for my culinary experiments!
Don't worry about the mess, it'll wash right off. Probably.
paul: The kitchen counter is... sticky.
Is that... no, I don't want to know.

carl: Ah, the bed! I made it extra comfy.
The stains? Night chocolate. Obviously.
paul: The sheets are in a heap on the floor.
There's an impression in the mattress. Like something heavy was dragged across it.

carl: Storage! Very practical for my projects.
Don't look inside though. It's a surprise.
paul: Why do we have barrels in the house?
I'm afraid to ask what Carl put inside.

carl: Light reading! Broadens the mind.
The butchery one has excellent sauce recipes!
'Disposing of Evidence'? That's fiction, Paul. FICTION.
paul: Carl's reading collection. Mostly cookbooks.
Wait... 'Advanced Butchery Techniques'? 'Disposing of Evidence: A Practical Guide'?
That second one has to be a joke. Right?

carl: My special project!
Don't open it, it's a surprise! A WONDERFUL surprise.
paul: Oh god. Oh god no.
What did you put in there, Carl?
I can hear... dripping.

carl: Structural integrity! Very important!
Those marks? Cats. Definitely cats. Big cats.
paul: A concrete support pillar.
There are scratches on it. Like fingernails.

carl: Supplies! For my hobbies.
Nothing you need to worry about, Paul.
paul: Wooden crate. Sealed shut.
Something inside shifts when I nudge it.
horror: The wood is warped from moisture.
Something dark seeps from the corner.

carl: The living room! Where ALL the living happens. And some of the dying.
I love what I've done with this space. Very open concept. Very... ventilated.
This room has the best acoustics. Trust me, I've tested it. Extensively.
paul: The living room looks normal. That's what worries me the most.
Something about this room feels wrong. Like it's been cleaned too thoroughly.
I used to feel safe in here. Past tense.

carl: My culinary laboratory! The experiments never stop!
I should really clean the ceiling. The splatter adds character though.
Hungry, Paul? I've got leftovers. SO many leftovers.
paul: The counter is still sticky. I'm not touching anything.
Why are there so many knives? We only had a set of four.
The garbage disposal has been running all morning. I'm not checking why.

carl: The feng shui is PERFECT now. Worth all the effort.
I sleep like a baby in here. Well, I sleep. The baby... never mind.
I reorganized the closet! Very efficient use of space now.
paul: The drag marks on the floor lead to the hallway. I can't unsee that.
There's a new lock on the closet door. From the outside.
The mattress has been flipped. Something dark stains the underside.

carl: The bathroom! Where miracles happen! And evidence disappears!
I've been experimenting with bath bombs. VERY red bath bombs.
The drain was clogged earlier. Fixed it though! Very hands-on.
paul: The grout between the tiles used to be white. It's pink now.
Someone scrubbed this bathroom recently. With bleach. A LOT of bleach.
The mirror still has that word on it. I can see it even through the fog.

carl: Welcome to the gallery! Every piece hand-selected. Hand-made. Hand... sourced.
The temperature is perfect for preservation down here. Very professional.
I need more wall space. The collection is growing faster than anticipated!
paul: I can hear dripping. Slow, rhythmic dripping. I don't want to find the source.
The air down here tastes like iron. I'm breathing through my mouth.
Every shadow looks like it's moving. I need to get back upstairs.

carl: Home sweet home! Isn't it WONDERFUL to have a place like this?
I should get a welcome mat. Something with personality. Something... organic.
The front door is always open, Paul! Well, for coming in. Not so much for leaving.
paul: The front door. Freedom is right there. But I can't leave yet.
There are scratches on the inside of the front door. Someone tried to get out.
The coat rack has too many coats. None of them are ours.

carl: Back at the door! Changed your mind about the tour?
The entry hall misses you when you leave, Paul!
paul: Back here again. The front door is still locked from the inside.
I keep coming back to this hallway. Like the house wants me here.

carl: Kitchen encore! Want to try my new recipe? It's a KILLER.
Back for seconds? The sauce is even better reheated!
paul: The kitchen again. The smell hasn't gotten any better.
I thought I cleaned that stain. It's back. Or it's a new one.

carl: You came back! I KNEW you'd appreciate the gallery!
Return visitor! Should I stamp your loyalty card?
paul: Why am I back down here? What am I hoping to find?
The basement. Again. The dripping is louder this time.

carl: Back in the living room! It's even MORE alive the second time around!
You can't stay away, can you? This room has a special energy!
paul: I'm back in here. Every time I return, I notice something new and horrible.
The living room again. Now I see the bleach stains on the carpet. Fresh bleach stains.

carl: Bedroom visit number TWO! The feng shui just keeps getting better!
Couldn't resist coming back? I understand. My design work is magnetic!
paul: Back in the bedroom. The closet door is slightly open now. I didn't open it.
I'm in the bedroom again. The drag marks seem deeper than before. Or I'm just seeing them clearly now.

carl: The bathroom beckons you back! That's normal. Totally normal behavior!
Another visit! The mirror really makes an impression, doesn't it?
paul: The bathroom. The word on the mirror is still there. Still 'SORRY'.
Back at the mirror. Each time I look, the handwriting seems more frantic.

carl: Oh, that's locked! I wonder where I put the key...
paul: It's locked. I need to find a key.

carl: The basement door! My gallery is down there!
I think I hid the key somewhere upstairs.
paul: The basement door. It's locked.
Carl always said never to go down there. That terrifies me.
The key fits. The lock clicks open.
Here we go...
I should go back up. There's nothing else I want to see down here.
Or maybe... I should look around more.
I can't just leave. I need to know what Carl has done.
The answers are somewhere in this house.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: The bedroom nightstand. Carl said to check under it.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: There's a trail of something leading to the basement door. I should follow it.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: Maybe Carl's journal has answers. He writes everything down.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: The bathroom mirror has something written on it. I should take a closer look.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: I should check the bedroom closet. Carl mentioned reorganizing it.

hints.speaker: paul
hints.text: The back door might be unlocked. It's worth checking for a way out.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: The house settles. Floorboards creak in rooms where nobody is standing.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: A faucet drips somewhere. The rhythm is almost like a heartbeat.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: The smell of copper and something sweet hangs in the air like a question.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: Something moves in the walls. A scratching sound, then silence.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: The air tastes metallic. Your tongue knows what blood tastes like even when your mind denies it.

ambient.speaker: narrator
ambient.text: A shadow crosses the hallway ahead. When you look directly at it, nothing is there.
